thread.title: Riley, O line lead Parkview to victory
thread.title_full: Riley, O line lead Parkview to victory

title: Riley, O line lead Parkview to victory
text:
Riley, O line lead Parkview to victory Steve Koehler 11:40 p.m. CDT October 16, 2015 Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's Brandon Horsley fights off Parkview's Warren Atkins in Springfield on October 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Lebanon's Adrian Palmer is brought down by the Parkview defense in Springfield on October 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Lebanon's visit to Parkview on Oct. 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Buy Photo Parkview's Anthony Riley gains a first down against visiting Lebanon on October 16, 2015. Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader Like this topic? You may also like these photo galleries: Replay Parkview defeated visiting Lebanon 42-35 on Friday. (Photo: Bruce E. Stidham/For the News-Leader) 49 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Sometimes, if a team can’t be good, they can be lucky, but Friday night, Parkview was good AND lucky in its 42-35 win over Lebanon on Senior Night at JFK Stadium. 
Representing the best Parkview has to offer, Anthony Riley scored 4 touchdowns and ran for an estimated 300 yards for the 4-5 Vikings. Riley, averaging 182 yards a game, nearly had that amount in the first half when he racked up 176 yards and two touchdown. 
“All the credit goes to the O line,” Riley said after his standout performance. “They open things up. I look for the openings and the holes. We practiced all week on facing this tough Lebanon defensive line.” 
Coach Anthony Hays said Riley’s performance was “Riley being Riley.” 
“He not only leads on the field but did you see him on the sidelines? He’s getting people up. He’s a leader,” Hays said. 
Riley showed off his talent when it was needed the most, late in the game when Lebanon looked to be turning the tide and putting together a rally. 
After a Lebanon score cut the lead to 35-28 with 4:56 left in the game Parkview took the ball on its own 20 and handed it to Riley on five of its seven offensive plays before he scored his final touchdown of the night on a 2-yard plunge. 
Earlier in the quarter, a Lebanon touchdown by quarterback Luke Winfrey cut the lead to 27-21 with 8:22 left, but Parkview took the ball from its own 20 and scored in three plays, ending with a thrilling 58-yard run by Chaviz Nyguen, who raced down the right sideline and veered across the entire width of the field to beat the Lebanon defense to the end zone. 
On the first possession of the game, Parkview dodged a bullet when an 11-play Yellowjackets drive came to a sudden stop when Lebanon fumbled on the Parkview 22 and the Vikings recovered. 
Parkview took the turnover and drove 78 yards for its first score, a 13-yard run by Riley. 
But Lebanon (5-4) scored twice in the next 22 seconds to take the lead, scoring on the first play of its possession, a 72-yard run by Brandon Horsley, who took a pitch, ran around left end and scampered down the sideline for the score. 
On the ensuing kickoff, Parkview’s receivers bobbled a handoff and Lebanon recovered on Parkview’s 3. It took Lebanon on play — a 3-yard run by Adrian Palmer — to put Lebanon ahead with 1:22 left in the first half. Lebanon would not score again until early in the fourth quarter. 
Parkview responded with a 9-play drive and scored on a 9-yard run by Riley to tie the ballgame. Parkview then took Lebanon’s first punt of the game at its own 32 and put together a 4-play drive, highlighted by a 61-yard run by Nyguen to take a 20-14 lead. 
It looked like Lebanon was going to score just before halftime, but Lebanon quarterback Luke Winfrey fumbled at the goal line and Parkview recovered. 49 CONNECT 3 TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE Read or Share this story: http://sgfnow.co/1RNFuw9 TOP VIDEOS
